intro: Hutera cheiranthos subsp. nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in high elevation areas.
